preguntas.raw:
The correct answer is 5.7.

According to the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation, the pH of a solution is related to the concentrations of the acid (HA) and its conjugate base (A-):

$$pH = pKa + \log\frac{[A^-]}{[HA]}$$

When the concentration of A- is 10 times greater than the concentration of HA, the equation becomes:

$$pH = pKa + \log10 = pKa + 1$$

Therefore, the pH of the solution is 1 unit higher than the pKa of the acid-base pair.

$$\Delta G^o = -nE^o\Delta z$$
